titleStmt.title: James A. Campbell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6306

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency. Thos E. Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioners would respectfully represent to Your Excellency that. at the March term 1865 of the Nicholas Circuit Court. Humphry M. Smart. was find $60, for selling Spiritus Liquors without License. his license having expired a short time previous to the commission of the alledged offence. Mr. Smart is a poor man with a large and helpless family. and himself a cripple, the selling was done by him not with a view of violating the laws of the Commonwealth but under belief that his License had not then expired. We would therefore respectfully request Your Excellency to remit the aforesaid fine of $60. or all with the exception of the attys" per cent and Costs, hoping You will grant our request. we remain very truly Your Fellow Citizens

Fitch Munger
W. P. Ross
Thomas Kennedy
John M Dallas
A. W Blair S. N. C.
Jno A. Campbell Clk, Co, Ct
John W. Campbell
Wm. W. Howard Clerk N. Cir Ct.
John F. Mc William
Elijah West P J N C C
J. H. Seeley Dep Pro. Mar. N. C.
John. M. Chevis
R J R Tilton
J. A. Mathers
G A Fisher PM

Nicholas Cir Ct
vs
H. M. Smarts
Petition for
Remission of Fine
$60
